Questions.QuestionString: The cabin light system provides illumination of the: (Level 1)
Answers: Cabin and entrances, lavatories and attendant work areas.
Cabin and entrances, galleys and attendant work areas.
Cabin and entrances, lavatories, galleys and attendant work areas.

Questions.QuestionString: The cabin lighting consists of: (Level 1)
In electrical emergency configuration, which cockpit lights remain ON? (Level 1)
Answers: CAPT dome light and RH CENTER lighting instrument panel.
F/O dome light and LH CENTER lighting instrument panel.
F/O dome light and F/O and RH CENTER lighting instrument panel.

Questions.QuestionString: When the Engines are running and the Cockpit Door is open, what is Lighting automatically switches to DIM2 brightness the: (Level 3)
When the LAV pushbutton is pressed on, lavatory door closed and locked, the integrallight comes on green and the Lighting of all the Lavatories comes on at: (Level 3)
How many dome lights provide shadowless general cockpit lighting? (Level 1)
A flood light located on the overhead panel is used to illuminate the: (Level 2)
Answers: Instruments and panels on the pedestal
Instruments and panels on the glare shield.

Questions.QuestionString: The passenger reading lights are installed in the: (Level 2)
Answers: Passenger Service Units (PSU) fitted under the passenger seats.
Passenger Service Units (PSU) fitted on the FAP.
Passenger Service Units (PSU) fitted above the passenger seats.

Questions.QuestionString: The reading lights can be tested, via the deus, using the: (Level 2)
The emergency lighting system can be controlled from the: (Level 3)
Answers: Cockpit by the Flight Crew and Cabin by the Cabin Attendants

Questions.QuestionString: The emergency lighting system provides illumination of the: (Level 1)
Answers: EXIT MARKING signs and EXIT LOCATION signs.

Questions.QuestionString: As soon as the 28 VDC ESS bus is lost, the lavatory auxiliary lights are: (Level 1)
Answers: Supplied by the EPSUs integrated batteries.

Questions.QuestionString: If the 28 VDC ESS BUS is lost, with the EMER exit light selector in the arm position, theemergency lighting system is supplied by the EPSUS integrated batteries: (Level 3)
In the exterior light control panel, switch the three position nose selector to the T.Oposition (Level 2)
Answers: Taxi and take-off light come on

Questions.QuestionString: When the strobe lights come on: (Level 3)
Answers: When the strobe light switch set to ON position.
When the strobe light switch set to AUTO position and landing gear is not compressed.
Switch set to ON position or AUTO position and landing gear is not compressed

Questions.QuestionString: Can you switch on the Emergency Lighting System? (Level 2)
Answers: Yes, on the FAP or form the cockpit.

Questions.QuestionString: When the logo lights come on: (Level 3)
Answers: The switch NAV& LOGO LIGHT set to On position and Landing gear is extended.

Questions.QuestionString: When the DIM2 pushbutton is pressed to control The ENTRY Areas Lighting the integrallight comes on green and the associated ENTRY Area comes on at: (Level 3)
With ANN LT SW in BRT position, the lighting of the ANN LT is activated: (Level 3)
Answers: If there is an action on the relative P/BSW (OFF position),
If the relative system failed or there is an action on the relative P/BSW (OFF position).

Questions.QuestionString: If engines are running and the cockpit door is open, the CIDS directors signal the DEU ofthe left forward entry light: (Level 3)
Answers: To set lighting to full brightness (100%),
To set lighting to DIM1 (50% BRT),

Questions.QuestionString: For CIDS enhanced. When the entrance lighting comes on automatically to 100% BRTlevel? (Level 3)
Answers: If full failure of the FAP and/or CIDS occurs,
If full failure of the FAP and/or CIDS occurs or cabin decompression occurs

Questions.QuestionString: With EMER EXIT LT switch OFF. When are the EXIT signs and the emergency escapehatch-handle lights come on? (Level 3)
Answers: When the NO SMOKING switch is ON position or in AUTO position with landing gearextended,
When landing gears down and locked,

Questions.QuestionString: With the EMER EXIT LT switch at ARM position. When the emergency lighting system issupplied from batteries of all EPSUs? (Level 3)
Answers: When the 28VDC NORM BUS voltage is not available,
When the 28VDC ESS SHED BUS voltage is not available,
When the 28VDC ESS BUS voltage is not available.

Questions.QuestionString: When are the avionic compartments lights come on? (Level 1)
Answers: When the AVIONICS COMPT LT P/B in cockpit is in AUTO and the relative avioniccompartment door open,
When the AVIONICS COMPT LT P/B in cockpit is set to ON,
When the AVIONICS COMPT LT P/B in cockpit is in AUTO and the relative avioniccompartment door open or When the AVIONICS COMPT LT P/B in cockpit is set to ON

Questions.QuestionString: When the TAXI and TAKE-OFF lights automatically go off? (Level 2)
Answers: When nose landing gear is down and locked,
When nose landing gear is retracted.

Questions.QuestionString: With the STROBE switch at auto position. When the strobe lights flash? (Level 3)
Answers: When MLG strut is not compressed,

Questions.QuestionString: When the LAND switch (L or R) is set to ON: (Level 1)
Answers: The corresponding LDG light come on immediately,
The corresponding LDG light come on when fully extended,
The corresponding LDG light come on when MLG down and locked,

Questions.QuestionString: If the RWY TURN OFF and LAND switches are all in the “ON” position, which lightautomatically extinguish after take off? (Level 3)
Answers: The RWY TURN OFF lights when the landing gear is retracted,

Questions.QuestionString: The navigation lights include: (Level 2)
Answers: RED light on the left hand, GREEN light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail
GREEN light on the left hand, RED light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail.
RED light on the left hand, WHITE light on the right hand and GREEN light on the APU tail.

Questions.QuestionString: Annunciators lights in the cockpit is supplied with: (Level 2)
Which lights illuminate when aircraft in clean configuration (flight control surfaces andLDGs retracted): (Level 2)
In case of emergency supply, annunciators lights in the cockpit is supplied by: (Level 2)
Answers: Static Inverter bus (901 XP) or Essential shed bus (801 XP)

Questions.QuestionString: If ANN LT SW is set in BRT position, the ANN LT is ON only if: (Level 3)
Answers: There is action on the relative P/B
There is system failure or action on the relative P/B

Questions.QuestionString: The EXIT light can be manually switched on from: (Level 2)
Door escape slide lights are switched on when: (Level 2)
Answers: The slides are armed and the doors are open.
The slides are armed or the doors are open.

Questions.QuestionString: When the MAIN ON pushbutton is pressed: (Level 2)
Answers: Cabin, entry Area lighting come on at full brightness.
Lavatories, Passenger lighting come on at full brightness

Questions.QuestionString: What happen when engines are running and cockpit door is open? (Level 3)
Answers: Forward entry lights set the intensity to 10%
Forward entry light set the intensity to 50%
Only left forward entry light set the intensity to 10%

Questions.QuestionString: When landing light selector in “ON’ position: (Level 2)
Answers: The landing lights are fully extended
Extends the landing light (left or right) which automatically comes on when fully extended.
The landing light( left or right) come on but not fully extended

Questions.QuestionString: In order to see the engine air intakes and wing leading edges, we have to switch on:(Level 1)
With the RWY turn off switch set to on, when are the runway turn off lights on (Level 1)
Answers: When nose landing gear is retracted.
When nose landing gear is downlocked

Questions.QuestionString: To program zone lighting in cabin, use: (Level 1)
If the RWY turn off, land and nose switches are all in the “ON” position, which lightautomatically extinguish after take off? (Level 3)
Answers: The TAKE OFF, RWY TURN OFF and LAND lights.
The NOSE and RWY TURN OFF lights when the landing gear is retracted.

Questions.QuestionString: When you select the seat belt switch to “ON” position: (Level 3)
Answers: The FASTEN SEAT BELT and RETURN TO SEAT signs come on together with a low tone chinesounds
The FASTEN SEAT BELT signs come on only
The FASTEN SEAT BELT and RETURN TO SEAT signs come on together with a high tonechine sounds

Questions.QuestionString: When AVIONICS COMPT LT switch in “AUTO” position: (Level 3)
Answers: The AVIONICS COMPT lighting is automatically controlled by corresponding access dooropening and closing
The AVIONICS COMPT lights automatically illuminated when one engine running
The AVIONICS COMPT lights automatically illuminated when A/C touchdown

Questions.QuestionString: What happen if emergency exit light selector in “ARM” position and normal aircraftelectrical power system fail? (Level 3)
Answers: All EMER EXIT signs and overhead emergency lighting automatically come on
The proximity emergency escape path marking system, overhead emergency lighting, andEXIT signs automatically come on

Questions.QuestionString: Push the power LAV switch on FAP, with lavatory door closed and locked: (Level 3)
Answers: The lavatory lighting FULL Brightness position

Questions.QuestionString: WING lights illuminate the Wing Leading Edges and Engines Air Intakes: (Level 1)
In electrical emergency configuration, which cockpit light remain: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: CAPT DOME light , F/O DOME light and standby compass
F/O DOME light , F/O RH centre instrument light and standby compass
F/O DOME light , CAPT/ LH centre instrument light and standby compass

Questions.QuestionString: Switch the taxi and take off light in T.O position: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: Take off and Taxi light come on

Questions.QuestionString: Which lighting includes fluorescent lamps and integral ballast units: (A, B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: Passenger reading lights and work attendant light
Cabin light, entrance light and lavatory lights

Questions.QuestionString: To program zone lighting in cabin, use: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Push the power lav switch on FAP, with lavatory door closed and locked : (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: The lavatory lighting in DIM position
The lavatory lighting in FULL Brightness position

Questions.QuestionString: In order to see the engine air intakes and wing leading edges, we have to switch on: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
The navigation lights include: (A, B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: RED light on the left hand, GREEN light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail.
GREEN light on the left hand, RED light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail.
WHITE light on the left hand, GREEN light on the right hand and RED light on the APU tail.

Questions.QuestionString: With the RWY turn off switch set to on, when are the runway turn off lights are on? (Level 1) (B1,B2)
Answers: When the nose landing gear is retracted.
When the nose landing gear is downlocked.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the logo light illuminate with the switch in 2 position? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: MLG strut compression or slat extension

Questions.QuestionString: When do the strobes flash in auto? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
If the RWY turn off, land and nose switches are all in the “ON” position, which light automatically extinguish after take off? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: The NOSE and RWY TURN OFF lights when the landing gear is retracted

Questions.QuestionString: What external light automatically illuminated when MLG strut is not compressed? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: The STROBES lights flash when the strobe switch in auto position

Questions.QuestionString: What happen when you select the ANN LT switch to “TEST” position? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: All annunciator lights come on and 8’s up in all LCDs
All annunciator lights on overhead panel come on
All annunciator lights changes it status

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the flood light? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
What is the purpose of the integrated light? (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: Illuminates all the instruments and panels in the cockpit

Questions.QuestionString: When landing light selector in “ON” position: (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: The landing lights are fully extended
Extends the landing light(left or right) which automatically comes on when fully extended
The landing light(left or right) comes on but not fully extended

Questions.QuestionString: With NO SMOKING selector in “AUTO” position the NO SMOKING and EXIT signs go off when: (B1,B2) (Level 2)
When you select the seat belt switch to “ON” position: (B1,B2) (Level 2)
Answers: The FASTEN SEAT BELT and RETURN TO SEAT signs come on together with a low tone chinesounds
The FASTEN SEAT BELT signs come on and low tone chime sounds only
The FASTEN SEAT BELT and RETURN TO SEAT signs come on together with a high tone chime sounds
